content:
Stylus Class

Definition

Provides access to general information about a tablet pen.

In this Article

public static class Stylus

Captured

Gets the element to which the stylus is bound.

public static System.Windows.IInputElement Captured { get; }
Value
IInputElement

The IInputElement to which the stylus is bound.

CurrentStylusDevice

Gets the stylus that represents the stylus currently in use.

public static System.Windows.Input.StylusDevice CurrentStylusDevice { get; }
Value
StylusDevice

The StylusDevice that represents the stylus currently in use.

DirectlyOver

Gets the element that is directly beneath the stylus.

public static System.Windows.IInputElement DirectlyOver { get; }
Value
IInputElement

The IInputElement that is directly beneath the stylus.

Capture(IInputElement)

Captures the stylus to the specified element.

public static bool Capture (System.Windows.IInputElement element);
element
IInputElement

The element to capture the stylus to.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stylus is captured to element; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the Capture method to ensure that element receives stylus events even when the cursor goes out of the elements' bounds. To release the stylus, call Capture(IInputElement,CaptureMode) with the CaptureMode set to CaptureMode.

The Capture method returns false if element is not visible or enabled.

Capture(IInputElement,CaptureMode)

Captures the stylus to the specified element.

public static bool Capture (System.Windows.IInputElement element, System.Windows.Input.CaptureMode captureMode);
element
IInputElement

The element to capture the stylus to.

captureMode
CaptureMode

One of the CaptureMode values.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stylus is captured to element; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the Capture method to ensure that element receives stylus events even when the cursor goes out of the elements' bounds. To release the stylus, call Capture with the CaptureMode set to CaptureMode.

The Capture method returns false if element is not visible or enabled.

GetIsFlicksEnabled(DependencyObject)

Gets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsFlicksEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static bool GetIsFlicksEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element);
element
DependencyObject

A UIElement or ContentElement on which to determine whether flicks are enabled.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified element has flicks enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

In Windows Vista, a flick, one of the possible system gestures, is a short, quick, straight stroke that can be mapped to a navigation or shortcut command. By default, flicks are disabled on the InkCanvas, InkPresenter, and ScrollBar. Flicks are enabled on all other controls.

GetIsPressAndHoldEnabled(DependencyObject)

Gets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static bool GetIsPressAndHoldEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element);
element
DependencyObject

A UIElement or ContentElement on which to determine whether press and hold is enabled.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified element has press and hold enabled; otherwise, false;

GetIsTapFeedbackEnabled(DependencyObject)

Gets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTapFeedbackEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static bool GetIsTapFeedbackEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element);
element
DependencyObject

A UIElement or ContentElement on which to determine whether tap feedback enabled.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified element has tap feedback enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

In Windows Vista, a short animation occurs when the user taps the control. By default, tap feedback is disabled on the InkCanvas. It is enabled on all other controls.

GetIsTouchFeedbackEnabled(DependencyObject)

Gets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTouchFeedbackEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static bool GetIsTouchFeedbackEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element);
element
DependencyObject

A UIElement or ContentElement on which to determine whether touch input feedback enabled.

Returns
Boolean

true if touch input feedback is enabled, otherwise false.

SetIsFlicksEnabled(DependencyObject,Boolean)

Gets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsFlicksEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static void SetIsFlicksEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element, bool enabled);
element
DependencyObject

The UIElement or ContentElement on which to enable flicks.

enabled
Boolean

true to enable flicks; false to disable flicks.

Remarks

In Windows Vista, a flick, one of the possible system gestures, is a short, quick, straight stroke that can be mapped to a navigation or shortcut command. By default, flicks are disabled on the InkCanvas, InkPresenter, and ScrollBar. Flicks are enabled on all other controls.

SetIsPressAndHoldEnabled(DependencyObject,Boolean)

Sets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsPressAndHoldEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static void SetIsPressAndHoldEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element, bool enabled);
element
DependencyObject

The UIElement or ContentElement on which to enable press and hold.

enabled
Boolean

true to enable press and hold; false to disable press and hold.

Remarks

Press and hold maps to the right-click on a mouse. In Windows Vista, you can disable this behavior on elements if you foresee a situation where the user might hold the tablet pen down without intending to simulate a right-click.

SetIsTapFeedbackEnabled(DependencyObject,Boolean)

Sets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTapFeedbackEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static void SetIsTapFeedbackEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element, bool enabled);
element
DependencyObject

The UIElement or ContentElement on which to enable tap feedback.

enabled
Boolean

true to enable tap feedback; false to disable tap feedback.

Remarks

In Windows Vista, a short animation occurs when the user taps the control. By default, tap feedback is disabled on the InkCanvas. It is enabled on all other controls.

SetIsTouchFeedbackEnabled(DependencyObject,Boolean)

Sets the value of the stem.Windows.Input.Stylus.IsTouchFeedbackEnabled* attached property on the specified element.

public static void SetIsTouchFeedbackEnabled (System.Windows.DependencyObject element, bool enabled);
element
DependencyObject

The UIElement or ContentElement on which to enable tap feedback.

enabled
Boolean

true to enable touch input feedback; false to disable touch input feedback.

Synchronize()

Synchronizes the cursor and the user interface.

public static void Synchronize ();

Remarks

Applications may need to determine the element on which the cursor is located. If the application uses animation, the DirectlyOver method might return an element that has moved out from under the cursor. Call Synchronize to be sure that DirectlyOver returns the proper element.
